item.title: 6 Metal Gear Games Ranked By Gameplay
item.description: Metal Gear launched as a series in 1987 as a game for Japanese computers. This would then turn into an NES game and the series grew from there. It is now over thirty years old and it seemed like the franchise was dead following Hideo Kojimaâ€™s departure.

item.title: The Witcher 3: How to Heal
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Ways To Heal In The Witcher 3
  • How To Heal During Battle In The Witcher 3

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the most popular RPGs from the PS4 and Xbox One era. However, it can be easy to forget how challenging it can be when fighting monsters and enemies. Surviving these encounters can sometimes be difficult, so it is vital to know how to keep Geralt healthy in and out of fights.

Geralt fights alone, save for the occasional team-up in certain quest. As such, it will be the player's responsibility to make sure that he doesn't run out of health during his adventures. There are a lot of systems at play in The Witcher 3 , and healing is arguably the most important, as Geralt's health doesn't regenerate over time.

Updated on July 2, 2024, by Michael Llewellyn: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt presents a surprising challenge for gamers, even on lower difficulty settings. Consequently, understanding how to heal, maneuver through the menus, and select the appropriate potions is crucial to those looking to survive the many dangerous encounters featured throughout the game. As such, this guide has been updated to include additional information about food and decoctions. It also provides a few tips that players should take note of when it comes to managing healing items in Geralt's inventory.

Ways To Heal In The Witcher 3

Geralt has access to various methods of healing both during and outside of combat. However, not all healing items are equally effective, and some can have negative side effects.

Food And Drink

Food and drink are the most reliable and safest methods to restore Geralt's health, and they are readily available from most merchants, inns, and item shops. Food can be harvested from the surrounding land as well. Whether it's fruit, meat, or honeycombs, there's always a source of food to be found in The Witcher 3 's world. Geralt can even eat raw meat if players wish him to, as Witchers are immune from most human diseases.

Food is easy to come by in The Witcher 3, so it is recommended that players grab and loot it whenever it's available. However, it's advisable to reserve alcohol and spirits for crafting potions after meditation. Although alcoholic beverages possess healing qualities, consuming them will intoxicate Geralt, impairing his performance. Geralt would benefit most from consuming flavored juices and cooked meats for optimal vitality regeneration.

Below is a list of some great foods and beverages that Geralt can use to heal himself, and they can all be purchased from inns.

  • Dried Fruit - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Dried Fruit & Nuts - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Apple Juice - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Grilled Pork - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Ham Sandwich - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Chicken Sandwich - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.
  • Whole Chicken - 15 Vitality Regeneration for 60 seconds.

Potions And Decotions

Potions and decoctions are consumable resources that Geralt can use to heal himself in The Witcher 3 . Potions like the Swallow come in standard, enhanced, and superior forms and are improved when Geralt finds new recipes/diagrams. The Witcher 3 's potions aren't just limited to healing; they can also offer protection against vampires, trolls, and other monsters.

Potions like the Killer Whale Potion will increase lung capacity by 50% for underwater activities, and the Troll Decoction will heal Geralt and boost his combat abilities by 20%. However, these consumables have severe drawbacks if players aren't mindful of how much they are using. Decoctions and Potions have toxicity levels , which prevent Geralt from using too much.

Toxicity is represented by the green bar in the HUD, and once it rises above 75 percent, Geralt's health will be compromised and will degenerate. Decoctions offer more buffs for Geralt to utlize, but they usually have higher toxcity. For instance, the Nightwraith Decoction boosts Geralt's maximum vitality by 50 for each foe defeated, while the toxicity level stands at 50 out of 100. The Swallow potions and White Raffords decoctions will likely be Geralt's go-to method for healing in combat and on the field due to their lower toxcity compared to other potions. The first recipe for crafting the Swallow potions will become available during the White Orchid quest.

Swallow potions offer vitality regeneration with 20 toxcity, and White Rafford decoctions offer instant healing at 25 toxcity.

Meditation

Meditation is the easiest way to heal Geralt in The Witcher 3 . Unfortunately, it doesn't replenish the Witcher's health in the harder difficulty settings. Players on easy to normal difficulty settings will discover that meditation is an effective method to replenish Geralt's vitality and advance time.

Meditation will only replenish potions for those playing The Witcher 3 on the higher difficulty levels.

How To Heal During Battle In The Witcher 3

Before Geralt can heal in battle or when he's exploring the land in The Witcher 3 , players will need to assign food or potions into his consumables slots. When the chosen consumable items are set, players can press up or down on the D-pad or R and F on a keyboard to heal Geralt .

How To Assign Healing Items

  • Open Geralt's Inventory .
  • Here, you will see four Consumable slots underneath Geralt's weapons and armor slots.
  • Potions, decoctions, and food can then be added to each slot.

Balancing healing and toxicity can be challenging. Players can utilize White Honey to eliminate toxicity levels, but it's important to remember that doing so also removes the effects of other potions.

A good standard practice would be to have two dedicated slots for healing potions, one for decoction, and one for food. This will give Witcher 3 players access to a good range of healing methods that they can rely on during tough encounters.

item.title: RE: XL - Best Races And Abilities Tier List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • RE: XL - Best Races Tier List
  • RE: XL - Best Abilities Tier List

While playing RE: XL , players can create hundreds of different builds from the many available abilities and races in the game. However, to become as strong as possible, you will need access to the most powerful ones.

Abilities in this Roblox RPG are set moves that players can use to fight. Races, on the other hand, can give you both passive buffs and unique skills, further strengthening the player. Some Abilities and Races in RE: XL are more powerful than others, and for those only looking for the best ones available, this guide will rank them all from best to worst.

RE: XL - Best Races Tier List

When starting an adventure in RE: XL , all players will receive the Human race. It is a starter race, and it does not provide any advantages. Only as you progress will you be able to reroll the race to get something better. To make it easier for you to decide which RE: XL race to use, the table below ranks them from best to worst.

Race

Tier

Fanalis

S Tier

Saiyan

S Tier

Majin

S Tier

Jiren

S Tier

Hybrid-Saiyan

S Tier

Frieza

A Tier

Uzumaki

A Tier

Celestial Dragon

A Tier

Human (Hybrid)

A Tier

Ghoul

A Tier

Mink

B Tier

Namekian

B Tier

Kumate Tribe

B Tier

Skypiean

B Tier

Torino Tribe

C Tier

A Bizarre Human

C Tier

Vermin

C Tier

Human

D Tier

Best RE: XL Races

As you can see, the S and A Tiers contain several races. And although some of them are very rare, getting them is more than worth the required effort. Here are a few reasons why S Tier races are the best races in RE: XL :

  • Majin - This race grants you a 95.25% boost to Damage and Speed. In addition, you double your Health and get the Quick Sleep skill, which can restore all your health in 5 seconds.
  • Saiyan - This race focuses on the Saiyan form, increasing the duration of the form and all its stats. In addition, your base Damage will be increased by 56.25%.
  • Fanalis - Once you acquire this race, you will receive a 45% boost to all strength-based abilities.

RE: XL - Best Abilities Tier List

Abilities are your primary weapon in RE: XL . Therefore, it is not surprising that more than 30 exist in the game. Like the races, the abilities in RE: XL are based on different anime, so every player can find something from their favorite franchise. However, if you want to become the strongest, you must prioritize using the best abilities in RE: XL . For players looking to do just that, the following table ranks the abilities in RE: XL from best to worst.

Ability

Tier

Insect Breathing

S Tier

One For All; Prime

S Tier

Cremation

S Tier

Lightning Dragon Slayer Magic

S Tier

Sound Breathing

S Tier

Pika Pika No mi

S Tier

Ittoryu; Shusui

S Tier

Eternal Horror Legendary Super Saiyan Broly

S Tier

S Tier

Gura Gura no mi

S Tier

B Tier

C Tier

Best RE: XL Abilities

In truth, you just need an S Tier ability to destroy the enemies in your way. However, players should also choose an ability that suits their playstyle. To help players decide what would work well for them, here are some of the best abilities to use in RE: XL :

  • Insect Breathing - This ability allows you to stun and poison enemies. In addition, you can weaken poisoned enemies.
  • Cremation - If you're looking for pure power, this is a great option. Your attacks will deal massive damage and have a large hitbox.
  • One For All - This is the best choice for farming thanks to its AoE attacks, which also deal huge damage.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Teases Potential Mauga Rework
item.description:
Highlights

  • Overwatch 2 may rework Mauga's abilities due to balance issues.
  • Cardiac Overdrive and incendiary bullets could see changes.
  • The potential rework may make Mauga more effective against squish heroes.

Overwatch 2 has teased a potential rework of Mauga's abilities. Mauga is one of the most recent additions to the Overwatch 2 roster, which has gained a tank that, like some other heroes, has exposed the recurring problem that Blizzard's hero shooter has with its balancing.

Mauga debuted in Overwatch 2 in December last year, and players quickly noticed the Samoan tank's strength. He proved to be highly resistant as tank heroes go while dealing high damage to opponents, along with healing himself and his allies. Mauga became so broken that some Overwatch 2 players quit the game in protest at the hero's lack of balance. Since then, Mauga has been a recurring name in Overwatch 2 patch notes, receiving five updates this year. Now, Overwatch 2 is commenting on possibly making big changes to his kit.

Overwatch 2 has teased that Mauga may receive a rework to his Cardiac Overdrive ability and his incendiary bullets. According to Lead Gameplay Designer Alec Dawson, speaking to Twitch streamer Spilo, the team is "looking at what they want to do with Cardiac Overdrive." Dawson reveals that experiments have been done before, but the devs feel there is still more to be tested. The devs also questioned the effectiveness of Mauga's incendiary bullets against squish targets, and how to bring their effectiveness to other parts of the kit. The Lead Gameplay Designer explains that the idea is to make Mauga more rewarding against squish heroes.

Mauga and Overwatch 2's Recurring Balancing Problem

During the five-second duration of Cardiac Overdrive, Mauga and his allies receive a 30% damage reduction and 60% of the damage dealt to enemies is converted into healing for him and his team. With Incendiary Chaingun, Mauga's left click, the tank fires 18 bullets per second out of a total of 300, causing direct damage. If an enemy is hit 10 times by the Incendiary Chaingun, they will take additional damage for three seconds.

Although Alec Dawson didn't give further details about Mauga's potential rework, an adjustment to Cardiac Overdrive could make sense if Overwatch 2 plans to make the hero a diving tank. These heroes are known for their impressive defensive power and high mobility. Incendiary Chaingun can easily hit tanks but struggle against targets with smaller hitboxes. A potential rework could help Mauga against these heroes but at the risk of making him the bane of tanks' existence. With frequent updates, players wait to find out if Mauga's rework will come, and what his place in the Overwatch 2 meta will be afterward.

item.title: Lies of P: Best Technique Weapons
item.description:
Technique weapons are categorized by their fast attacks that allow for more agile playstyles in Lies of P . They may not hit as hard as the ones that scale off Motivity, but they make up for it with their speed and capacity for aggression.

While all other weapons in Lies of P can be turned into Technique weapons via Cranks and Handle alterations, the following list only contains those that are designed to scale off the Technique stat by default, maximizing the effectiveness of Cranks while sparing players the need to swap handles.

Updated July 2, 2024 by Marc Santos: This list of the best Technique weapons for Lies of P remains accurate even after all the changes that have been implemented into the game since its release. Every weapon can and will carry players all the way to the end, though some are objectively better than others in terms of raw damage stats. This guide has been updated to include one additional weapon that received a major damage buff after the game's 1.3.0 update that saw sweeping changes to many weapons across most (if not all) categories.

Wintry Rapier

Despite being a starter weapon, the Wintry Rapier is more than capable of carrying players throughout the entire campaign as long as it's upgraded. The weapon's fast stabs and reliable Fable Arts make it a solid choice for any Technique build.

Stabbing weapons are naturally weak against groups of enemies, but it shouldn't be an issue if players can isolate their targets. With enough skill and constant use of weapon buffs via the Grinder and consumables, the Wintry Rapier will be able to take down even the biggest of enemies as effectively as the moment it was picked up in the train.

Etiquette

This fancy umbrella doubles as a rapier designed for thrusting attacks. It may seem weak at first, but if you invest enough upgrade materials in it, Etiquette turns into a complete monster that's capable of bum rushing bosses well into the lategame, especially since it got a significant damage buff in the game's 1.3.0 patch.

Etiquette has good range and can continuously stagger enemies extremely well for a one-handed weapon. Also, it's one of the very few weapons in the game that can get an S scaling with Technique. It does get outclassed by other options damage-wise, but it's hard to deny that this weapon is strong in its own right.

Booster Glaive

The Booster Glaive is a slow but powerful weapon that can help players close gaps via its Blade Fable Art and charged heavy attacks. Its rocket-powered handle will send players hurtling toward their targets to deliver powerful blows at the cost of having a slow base attack speed.

Despite being slow, what makes the Booster Glaive valuable is its aforementioned gap closers and its base B scaling for Technique, which can be increased to A with a Technique Crank. This weapon can one-shot most human-sized enemies, and it can comfortably perform hit-and-run tactics thanks to its unique handle. It can be obtained by opening the chest in the Puppet of the Future's pit in Venigni Works.

Dancer's Curved Sword

Players who want something more exotic may want to use the Dancer's Curved Sword instead. Its moveset resembles the graceful movements of a dancer, effectively allowing it to attack faster than other greatswords like the Booster Glaive or Holy Sword of the Ark.

Speed is the Dancer's Curved Sword's greatest strength. It has a high DPS potential, making it an excellent choice for players who can constantly stagger enemies or exploit long recovery times. This weapon can be found in a chest on Rosa Isabelle Street, near the open air theatre where players fight the White Lady.

Tyrant Murderer's Dagger

This inconspicuous dagger sold by Pulcinella is one of the few weapons in the game that can critically strike . It has a base critical rate of 30, which gives all of its attacks a chance to deal additional damage. Its blade also comes with the Grind Fable Art, which increases the critical rate even further.

The Tyrant Murderer's Dagger suffers from the low range inherent to all knives. This isn't necessarily bad, especially for those who can comfortably fight in close quarters. However, it's worth noting that the blade will retain its critical hit properties even when attached to other handles. Consider using the City Long Spear Handle with it so it retains a B scaling on Technique without losing its stab-focused moveset.

Puppet Ripper

Puppet King Romeo's scythe has what might be the longest range out of any two-handed melee weapon in the game. A fully charged heavy attack from it sends the blade flying around players before snapping back into place. It's great for hitting distant enemies, but its true strength lies in its ability to hit targets through obstacles.

Charged attacks from the Pupper Ripper do not bounce off the environment. If players and their target are in between a carriage, low wall, tree, or other similar obstacle, then the Puppet Ripper will still hit them no matter what happens. It's still a decent weapon outside this scenario though, so don't be afraid to duel properly with it.

Two Dragons Sword

Out of all weapons in Lies of P, the Two Dragons Sword is one of the two weapons that can get an S scaling in Technique (next to Etiquette, as mentioned earlier). Because of that, it'll deal the most damage out of everything else when used in a Technique build, and its moveset isn't bad at all, either.

The Two Dragons Sword is a special weapon that focuses on counter-attacks. Its heavy attack can be used to parry incoming hits and immediately follow up with a devastating flourish that's often enough to stagger most enemies. The weapon's Blade Fable Art works as a forward dodge as well, giving players more options to press their attack.

Proof of Humanity

The special weapon earned from killing the final boss in the game is expectedly strong and just as flashy. It can slash rapidly with its heavy attacks, and it can also critically strike by default, just like the Tyrant Murderer's Dagger. It doesn't scale as well with Technique as the Two Dragons Sword, but it still hits hard thanks to that base crit chance it has.

The only real downside to Proof of Humanity is that it'll only really be useful on NG+ and beyond, given how it's dropped by the final boss. It won't make the first campaign run any easier, but it's a fun and powerful tool to use if players find themselves craving more of the game's tight combat.
